result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew L. Anderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Portage County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay within 60 days or you will need to set up a payment plan. Payment plan enrollments are in person on Monday of each week.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew L. Anderson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Matthew L. Anderson
Current: 1502 Water Street, Stevens Point, WI 54481 United States  (Effective: 07-23-2015)
Prior: 1502 Water St, Stevens Point, WI 54481 United States
Statement Regarding Recusal - Molepski, Jr/Judge Finn

Defendant Matthew L. Anderson in court with Attorney Ryan W. Drengler.  David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

11:11 a.m. Court calls case.
Atty Knaapen states the appearances.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
Count 1 - No Contest

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorney stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on Count 1.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Parties are ready to proceed to sentencing.
Prosecutor argues regarding sentencing recommendations.
Attorney for Defendant argues regarding sentencing recommendations.
Court asks the Defendant if he/she wants to make any statements.

BY THE COURT:
Pay fine of $200 + costs which would include the DNA Surcharge and Drug Abuse Surcharge.
Pay within 60 days or you will need to set up a payment plan. Payment plan enrollments are in person on Monday of each week.
Plea hearing on July 14, 2014 at 11:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on July 14, 2014 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Matthew L. Anderson in court with attorney Ryan W Drengler. David R Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  
State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea entered.

Bond Continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 14, 2014 at 11:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Matthew L. Anderson
Current: 1502 Water St, Stevens Point, WI 54481 United States  (Effective: 06-12-2014)
Prior: 2816 Frontenac Ave Apt A, Stevens Point, WI 54481

Defendant Matthew L. Anderson in court with attorney Ryan W Drengler. Defendant Matthew L. Anderson in custody. David R Knaapen and Intern Taylor Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

State files Information.
Defense requests arraignment be held on a different date and time.  Arraignment scheduled for June 30, 2014 at 10:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on June 9, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Matthew L. Anderson in court with attorney (Atty Drury) for Ryan W Drengler. Intern Krause w/ David R Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
$100 sig bond in file is continued.
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 9, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
